page.title: 16PRUDHOE CASTLE
page.content: Prudhoe Castle was built by the Umpravilles between 1161 and 1189. The castle is situated overlooking the river on the outskirts of Prudhoe. The entrance fee is 30p for adults and 15p for children. The castle is undergoing restoration work. There is a tarpaulin over the roof of the keep to shelter the rebuilding work. There is a bridge by the castle which is unique, it has a pointed arch at one side and a rounded arch at the other. By the bridge is the mill. Inside is a grinding stone which weighs about 2 tons. The watermill dam has since dried up, but the stone chute is still there, covered in moss and algae.
